description.raw:
This PR adds support for the collide\_bitmask feature \(present in Gazebo classic\) to disable collisions between sets of objects.

Since I’m quite new at ign-physics there might be a few rough edges and, while it works in my scenario, I’m not quite sure it is either the right approach to do it or whether it works in all cases, I’ll get some more worlds \(like the gazebo classic example one to explain collide\_bitmasks\) in the coming days and double check it works as intended.

A few parts that I’d like feedback on:

* Is this actually the right way to implement such a feature? Again being new at ign-physics it’s quite the learning curve.
* Is the Feature definition correct? Is that the right place to put it? Since it’s a shape feature I thought about adding it to Shape.hh but was afraid about what might have happened if there was a physics engine that didn’t provide it.
* I’m also not very familiar with the DART API so if there is anything obviously wrong there feel free to let me know.
* When populating the hashmap bitmask\_map I noticed \(by adding a print statement\) that even for a moderate number of objects there is a huge number of entries being added, I suspect this is due to using shapes but again I’m not too sure.

‌
description.html:
This PR adds support for the collide_bitmask feature (present in Gazebo classic) to disable collisions between sets of objects.

Since I’m quite new at ign-physics there might be a few rough edges and, while it works in my scenario, I’m not quite sure it is either the right approach to do it or whether it works in all cases, I’ll get some more worlds (like the gazebo classic example one to explain collide_bitmasks) in the coming days and double check it works as intended.

A few parts that I’d like feedback on:

  • Is this actually the right way to implement such a feature? Again being new at ign-physics it’s quite the learning curve.
  • Is the Feature definition correct? Is that the right place to put it? Since it’s a shape feature I thought about adding it to Shape.hh but was afraid about what might have happened if there was a physics engine that didn’t provide it.
  • I’m also not very familiar with the DART API so if there is anything obviously wrong there feel free to let me know.
  • When populating the hashmap bitmask_map I noticed (by adding a print statement) that even for a moderate number of objects there is a huge number of entries being added, I suspect this is due to using shapes but again I’m not too sure.

‌

This PR adds support for the collide_bitmask feature (present in Gazebo classic) to disable collisions between sets of objects.

Since I’m quite new at ign-physics there might be a few rough edges and, while it works in my scenario, I’m not quite sure it is either the right approach to do it or whether it works in all cases, I’ll get some more worlds (like the gazebo classic example one to explain collide_bitmasks) in the coming days and double check it works as intended.

A few parts that I’d like feedback on:

  • Is this actually the right way to implement such a feature? Again being new at ign-physics it’s quite the learning curve.
  • Is the Feature definition correct? Is that the right place to put it? Since it’s a shape feature I thought about adding it to Shape.hh but was afraid about what might have happened if there was a physics engine that didn’t provide it.
  • I’m also not very familiar with the DART API so if there is anything obviously wrong there feel free to let me know.
  • When populating the hashmap bitmask_map I noticed (by adding a print statement) that even for a moderate number of objects there is a huge number of entries being added, I suspect this is due to using shapes but again I’m not too sure.
